To piggyback: WASHINGTON (Reuters) – Americans have grown more optimistic about the economy and the direction of the country since President Barack Obama took office in January, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll on Monday. Two-thirds of respondents said they approved of Obama's overall job performance. The number of respondents who said the country was headed in the wrong direction dropped to 53 percent from 79 percent... "http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20090407/us_nm/us_usa_poll_economy"

content: quote: Originally posted by mcgreer: quote: Originally posted by EAG154: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by EAG154: and the corporate big wigs! Odd comment coming from a Republican. Your the party of corporate big wigs! Bush gazed around the diamond-studded $800-a-plate crowd and commented on the wealth on display. "This is an impressive crowd - the haves and the have-mores," quipped the GOP standard-bearer. "Some people call you the elites; I call you my base." Obama looked around the room and shouted turkeys! turkeys! squawk, squawk, squawk Tell that to the GIs he's visiting in Iraq right now. I'll let you tell them, you can also tell them how your brain jumped to GI's when they were no part of the topic and how YOUR brain related them to turkeys!
